The team is controlled by the [[Football Union of Russia]] and affiliated with [[UEFA]]. [[Sergey Skorovich]] is currently managing the team. Russia qualified for four [[FIFA Futsal World Cup|World Cups]], [[1992 FIFA Futsal World Championship|1992]], [[1996 FIFA Futsal World Championship|1996]], [[2000 FIFA Futsal World Championship|2000]], [[2008 FIFA Futsal World Cup|2008]] and for every edition of [[UEFA Futsal Championship|European Championship]]. ==History== ===Beginning=== Russia's FIFA Futsal World Cup history began inauspiciously in 1992, when a poor defensive record of 16 goals conceded in three matches meant elimination at the group stage. A dramatic turnaround in Spain four years later saw the Russians claim an impressive third spot with a 3-2 success over neighbours Ukraine in the deciding match. Russia's most recent appearance on the world stage came at the 2000 finals in Guatemala, where they took fourth after a 4-2 defeat to Portugal in the third-place play-off. At the UEFA Futsal Championship in late 2007, a new generation picked up the thread of previous FIFA Futsal World Cup performances and finished third, gaining revenge over Portugal for a defeat at the same stage in 2000. ===Recently=== Russia were drawn in a group of three nations in qualifying for the FIFA Futsal World Cup Brazil 2008, but after France withdrew at the last minute, the berth in the next round was decided in a single eliminator against Serbia. The Russians duly won 3-2 to book a play-off spot with Belarus, one of the surprise packages at the group stage, but the experience of three appearances at the FIFA Futsal World Cup finals told in the end as the Russians eased to a 6-2 aggregate win. Much of the credit goes to keeper Pavel Stepanov for conceding only four goals in three matches. At the final tournament, '''Russia''' were drawn in [[FIFA Futsal World Cup 2008#Group A|Group A]] along with [[Brazil national futsal team|Brazil]], [[Japan national futsal team|Japan]], [[Cuba national futsal team|Cuba]] and [[Solomon Islands national futsal team|Solomon Islands]]. Losing against Brazil and winning the other three games, Russia finished second and qualified for the [[2008 FIFA Futsal World Cup - Second Round|Second Round]]. This time '''Russia''' were drawn in Group F together with [[Spain national futsal team|Spain]], [[Argentina national futsal team|Argentina]] and [[Paraguay national futsal team|Paraguay]]. After losing to [[Spain national futsal team|Spain]] in the opening match, Russia went on to win against Paraguay and draw with Argentina to scrape through to set-up a semi-final against Brazil. However, '''Russia''' were unable to past [[Brazil national futsal team|Brazil]] and eventually they had to content with the fourth place after losing out to [[Italy national futsal team|Italy]] in
